29.verse: “Hence, do not be greatly concerned about what you are to eat and what you are to drink. Do not worry.

30.verse: The nations of the world are concerned for all these things. Your Father is aware of your needs.

31.verse: Rather, seek his kingdom, and these things will be given to you as well.

32.verse: Treasure in Heaven. -“Fear not, little flock, for your Father has chosen to give you the kingdom.

33.verse: Sell your possessions and give to those in need. Provide money bags for yourselves that do not wear out, an inexhaustible treasure in heaven that no thief can come near and no moth can destroy.

34.verse: For where your treasure is, there will your heart also be.

35.verse: Parables about Watchfulness -The Parable of the Vigilant Steward. -“Fasten your belts for service and have your lamps lit.

36.verse: Be like servants who are waiting for their master to return from a wedding banquet, so that they may open the door as soon as he comes and knocks.

37.verse: Blessed are those servants whom the master finds awake when he arrives. Amen, I say to you, he will fasten his belt, have them recline to eat, and proceed to wait on them himself.

38.verse: If he comes in the second watch or in the third and finds them still awake, blessed are those servants.

39.verse: The Hour of the Son of Man. -“But keep this in mind: if the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have left his house to be broken into.

40.verse: So you must also be prepared, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.”

41.verse: The Parable of the Faithful Servant. -Then Peter asked, “Lord, are you directing this parable to us or do you mean it for everyone?”

42.verse: The Lord replied, “Who then is the faithful and wise steward whom his master will put in charge of his household to give its members their allotment of food at the proper time?

43.verse: Blessed is that servant if his master finds him doing so when he arrives home.

44.verse: Truly I tell you, he will put him in charge of all his property.

45.verse: “But if that servant says to himself, ‘My master is detained in arriving,’ and he proceeds to beat the menservants and the maids, and to eat and drink and get drunk,

46.verse: the master of that servant will return on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not know. He will punish him and assign him a place with the unfaithful.

47.verse: “The servant who knew his master’s wishes but did not get ready or do what his master wanted will receive a severe beating.

48.verse: But the one who did not know those wishes, and who acted in such a manner as to deserve a beating, will be beaten less severely. Much will be demanded of a person to whom much has been given, and even more will be asked of a person to whom more has been entrusted.

49.verse: The Urgency of Making the Decision -Jesus and His Passion. -“I have come to spread fire on the earth, and how I wish it were already blazing!

50.verse: I have a baptism with which to be baptized, and how great is my anguish until it has been completed!

51.verse: Jesus, Cause of Dissensions. -“Do you think that I have come to bring peace to the earth? No, I tell you, but rather division.

52.verse: “From now on a household of five will be divided, three against two and two against three;

53.verse: they will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”

54.verse: Discerning the Signs of the Times. -He also said to the crowds, “When you see a cloud rising in the west, you immediately say, ‘It is going to rain,’ and so it happens.

55.verse: And when you see the wind blowing from the south, you say, ‘It is going to be hot,’ and so it happens.

56.verse: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of earth and sky. Why then do you not know how to interpret the present time?

57.verse: Reconciling with Others before the Judgment. -“And why do you not judge for yourselves what is right?

58.verse: Thus, when you are going to court with your opponent, make an effort to settle the matter with him on the way. If you fail to do so, he may drag you before the judge, and the judge will hand you over to the officer, and the officer will throw you into prison.

59.verse: I tell you, you will not be given your freedom until you have paid your debt down to the very last penny.”

1.verse: Chapter 13 -Jesus Calls for Repentance. -At that time, some people who were present told Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mingled with the blood of their sacrifices.

2.verse: He asked them, “Do you think that because the Galileans suffered in this way they were worse sinners than all other Galileans?

3.verse: No, I tell you. But unless you repent, you will all perish as they did.

4.verse: Or those eighteen people who were killed when the tower fell on them at Siloam—do you think that they were more guilty than all the others living in Jerusalem?

5.verse: No, I tell you—but unless you repent, you will all perish as they did.”

6.verse: The Parable of the Barren Fig Tree. -Then he told them this parable: “A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, but whenever he came looking for fruit on it, he found none.

7.verse: Therefore, he said to his vinedresser, ‘For three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree and have never found any. Cut it down! Why should it continue to use up the soil?’

8.verse: But the vinedresser replied, ‘Sir, let it alone for one more year while I dig around it and fertilize it.

9.verse: Perhaps it will bear fruit next year. If so, well and good. If not, then you can cut it down.’ ”

10.verse: Jesus Heals a Woman on the Sabbath. -On one Sabbath as Jesus was teaching in the synagogue,

11.verse: a woman was present, possessed by a spirit that had crippled her for eighteen years. She was bent over and completely unable to stand up straight.

12.verse: When Jesus saw her, he called her forward and said, “Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.”

13.verse: Then he laid his hands on her, and immediately she stood up straight and began praising God.

14.verse: But the leader of the synagogue was indignant because Jesus had effected a cure on the Sabbath, and he said to the assembled people, “There are six days when work is permitted. Come on those days and be cured, and not on the Sabbath.”

15.verse: The Lord said to him in reply, “You hypocrites! Is there a single one of you who does not untie his ox or his donkey and lead it from its stall to give it water on the Sabbath?

16.verse: Should not this woman, a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has held bound for eighteen long years, be set free from this bondage on the Sabbath?”

17.verse: At these words, all his adversaries were put to shame, and the people rejoiced at all the wonderful things he was doing.

18.verse: The Parable of the Mustard Seed. -He went on to say, “What is the kingdom of God like? To what shall I compare it?

19.verse: It is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds of the air made nests in its branches.”

20.verse: The Parable of the Yeast. -Again he said, “To what shall I compare the kingdom of God?

21.verse: It is like yeast that a woman took and mixed with three measures of flour until it was completely leavened.”

22.verse: The Destiny of Israel -Who Will Enter into the Kingdom of God? -Jesus continued journeying through towns and villages, teaching as he made his way to Jerusalem.

23.verse: Someone asked him, “Lord, will only a few be saved?” He answered,

24.verse: “Strive to enter through the narrow door, for many, I tell you, will try to enter but will not succeed in doing so.

25.verse: “When once the master of the house has gotten up and shut the door, you may find yourself standing outside knocking on the door and begging, ‘Lord, open the door for us.’ He will say in reply, ‘I do not know where you come from.’

26.verse: Then you will protest, ‘We ate and drank with you, and you taught in our streets.’

27.verse: But he will say, ‘I do not know where you come from. Depart from me, all you evildoers!’

28.verse: “There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the Prophets in the kingdom of God as you yourselves are being thrown out.

29.verse: Then from the east and the west, and from the north and the south, people will come and take their places at the banquet in the kingdom of God.

30.verse: Indeed some are last who will be first, and some are first who will be last.”

31.verse: Herod’s Desire To Kill Jesus. -At that time, some Pharisees came and said to him, “Leave this place and go somewhere else, for Herod wants to kill you.”

32.verse: He answered them, “Go and tell that fox: ‘Behold, today and tomorrow I will be casting out demons and healing people, and on the third day I will finish my work.

33.verse: Yet I must continue to go on today and tomorrow and the next day, since it would not be right for a prophet to be killed outside Jerusalem.

34.verse: The Lament over Jerusalem. -“Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you murder the Prophets and stone the messengers sent to you! How often have I longed to gather your children together as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you would not allow it!

35.verse: Behold, your house has been abandoned. I tell you, you will not see me until you say: ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.’ ”

1.verse: A Dinner Given by a Pharisee -Chapter 14 -Jesus Heals a Man with Dropsy on the Sabbath. -On one Sabbath, Jesus went to dine at the home of a prominent Pharisee, and the people were watching him closely.

2.verse: In front of him there was a man suffering from dropsy,

3.verse: and Jesus asked the lawyers and the Pharisees, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not?”

4.verse: When they offered no reply, he took the man, healed him, and sent him on his way.

5.verse: Then he said to them, “If one of you has a son or an ox that has fallen into a well, will you not immediately pull him out on the Sabbath day?”

6.verse: And they were unable to give him any answer.

7.verse: The Parable of the Ambitious Guest. -When he noticed how the guests were securing places of honor, he told them a parable:

8.verse: “When you have been invited by someone to attend a wedding banquet, do not sit down in the place of honor in case someone who is more distinguished than you may have been invited,

9.verse: and then the host who invited both of you may approach you and say, ‘Give this man your place.’ Then you will be embarrassed as you proceed to sit in the lowest place.

10.verse: “Rather, when you are invited, proceed to sit in the lowest place, so that when your host arrives, he will say to you, ‘My friend, move up to a higher place.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all your fellow guests.

11.verse: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”

12.verse: Invite the Needy. -Then he said to the one who had invited him, “When you host a luncheon or a dinner, do not invite your friends or your brothers or your relatives or your wealthy neighbors, lest they invite you back and thus repay you.

13.verse: Rather, when you hold a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, and the blind.

14.verse: Then indeed will you be blessed because they have no way to repay you. But you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.”

15.verse: The Parable of the Great Supper. -On hearing this, one of the dinner guests said to him, “Blessed is the man who will dine in the kingdom of God.”

16.verse: Jesus said in reply, “A man gave a sumptuous banquet, to which he invited many.

17.verse: When the hour for the banquet drew near, he sent his servant to say to those who had been invited: ‘Come, for everything is now ready.’

18.verse: “But one after another they all began to make excuses. The first said, ‘I have bought a parcel of land, and I must go out to inspect it. Please accept my apologies.’

19.verse: Another said, ‘I have purchased five yoke of oxen, and I am on my way to try them out. Please accept my regrets.’

20.verse: Still another said, ‘I have just gotten married, and therefore I am unable to come.’

21.verse: “When the servant returned, he reported all this to his master. Then the owner of the house became enraged, and he said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the town and bring in here the poor, the crippled, the blind, and the lame.’

22.verse: Shortly afterward, the servant told him, ‘Sir, your orders have been carried out, and some room is still available.’

23.verse: Then the master said to the servant, ‘Go out to the open roads and along the hedgerows and compel people to come, so that my house may be filled.

24.verse: For I tell you, not one of those who were invited shall taste my banquet.’ ”

25.verse: Conditions To Be a Disciple -Renunciation of Everything for Jesus. -Great crowds were accompanying Jesus on his journey, and he turned to them and said,

26.verse: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, yes, and even his own life, he cannot be my disciple.

27.verse: Whoever does not carry his own cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.

28.verse: “Which one of you, intending to build a tower, would not first sit down and estimate the cost, to see whether he has sufficient funds for its completion?

29.verse: Otherwise, if he has laid the foundation and then finds himself unable to finish the work, all who see it will ridicule him, saying,

30.verse: ‘There goes the man who started to build but was unable to complete the work.’

31.verse: “Or what king marching into battle against another king will not first sit down and consider whether with ten thousand soldiers he can defeat the enemy coming to oppose him with twenty thousand?

32.verse: If he cannot, then, while the enemy is still a long distance away, he will send a delegation to ask for terms of peace.

33.verse: In the same way, any one of you who does not renounce all of his possessions cannot be my disciple.

34.verse: The Simile of Salt. -“Salt is good. But if salt loses its taste, what can be done to make it salty once again?

35.verse: It is fit neither for the soil nor for the dungheap. Thus, it can only be thrown away. He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”

1.verse: Salvation—Joy and Torment of God -Chapter 15 -This Man Receives Sinners. -Now the tax collectors and sinners were all crowding around to listen to Jesus,

2.verse: and the Pharisees and the scribes began to complain, saying, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”

3.verse: The Parable of the Lost Sheep. -Therefore, he told them this parable:

4.verse: “Which one of you, if you have a hundred sheep and lose one of them, will not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness and go after the one that is lost until he finds it?

5.verse: And when he does find it, he lays it on his shoulders joyfully.

6.verse: Then, when he returns home, he calls together his friends and neighbors and says to them, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found my sheep that was lost.’

7.verse: In the same way, I tell you, there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous people who have no need of repentance.

8.verse: The Parable of the Lost Coin. -“Or again, what woman who has ten silver coins and loses one will not light a lamp and sweep the house, searching thoroughly until she finds it?

9.verse: And when she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors and says to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the coin that I lost.’

10.verse: In the same way, I tell you, there is rejoicing among the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”

11.verse: The Parable of the Lost (or Prodigal) Son. -Then he said: “There was a man who had two sons.

12.verse: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of your estate that I will inherit.’ And so the father divided the property between them.

13.verse: “A few days later the younger son gathered together everything he had and traveled to a distant country, where he squandered his inheritance on a life of dissolute living.

14.verse: When he had spent it all, a severe famine afflicted that country, and he began to be in need.

15.verse: So he went and hired himself out to one of the local inhabitants who sent him to his farm to feed the pigs.

16.verse: He would have willingly filled his stomach with the pods that the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.

17.verse: “Then he came to his senses and said, ‘How many of my father’s hired workers have more food than they can consume, while here I am, dying of hunger.

18.verse: I will depart from this place and go to my father, and I will say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.

19.verse: I am no longer worthy to be called your son. Treat me like one of your hired workers.” ’

20.verse: “So he set out for his father’s house. But while he was still a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion. He ran to him, threw his arms around him, and kissed him.

21.verse: Then the son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’

22.verse: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Quickly bring out the finest robe we have and put it on him. Place a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.

23.verse: Then bring the fatted calf and kill it, and let us celebrate with a feast.

24.verse: For this son of mine was dead and has come back to life. He was lost, and now he has been found.’ And they began to celebrate.

25.verse: “Now the elder son had been out in the fields, and as he returned and drew near the house, he could hear the sounds of music and dancing.

26.verse: He summoned one of the servants and inquired what all this meant.

27.verse: The servant replied, ‘Your brother has come home, and your father has killed the fatted calf because he has him back safe and sound.’

28.verse: The elder son then became angry and refused to go in. His father came out and began to plead with him,

29.verse: but he said to his father in reply, ‘All these years I have worked like a slave for you, and I never once disobeyed your orders. Even so, you have never even given me a young goat so that I might celebrate with my friends.

30.verse: But when this son of yours returns after wasting his inheritance from you on prostitutes, you kill the fatted calf for him.’

31.verse: “Then the father said to him, ‘Son, you are with me always, and everything I have is yours.

32.verse: But it was only right that we should celebrate and rejoice, because this brother of yours was dead and has come to life; he was lost and now he has been found.’ ”

1.verse: Chapter 16 -Riches and Poverty -The Parable of the Crafty Steward. -Jesus also said to his disciples: “There was a rich man who had a steward, and he was informed that this steward was squandering his property.

2.verse: Therefore, he summoned him and said, ‘What are these reports that I hear about you? Give me an accounting of your stewardship, because you can no longer be my steward.’

3.verse: “Then the steward said to himself, ‘What am I going to do, now that my master is dismissing me from being steward? I am not strong enough to dig, and I am too ashamed to beg.

4.verse: What I must do is to make sure that people will welcome me into their homes once I am removed from being steward.’

5.verse: “Then he summoned his master’s debtors one by one. He asked the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’

6.verse: When he was told, ‘One hundred jars of olive oil,’ he said to the man, ‘Take your bill, sit down quickly, and change the number to fifty.’

7.verse: Then he asked another, ‘And you, how much do you owe?’ When he was told, ‘One hundred measures of wheat,’ he said to him, ‘Take your bill and make it eighty.’

8.verse: The master commended the crafty steward because he had acted shrewdly. For the children of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their own kind than are the children of light.

9.verse: Application of the Parable. -“And I tell you: use your worldly wealth to make friends for yourselves so that, when it has been exhausted, they will welcome you into eternal dwellings.

10.verse: “Whoever can be trusted in small matters can also be trusted in great ones, but whoever is dishonest in small matters will also be dishonest in great ones.

11.verse: Therefore, if you have not been trustworthy in handling worldly wealth, who will entrust you with true riches?

12.verse: And if you have not shown yourself to be trustworthy with what belongs to another, who will give you anything of your own?

13.verse: “No servant can serve two masters. For you will either hate the one and love the other or be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and money.”

14.verse: Teachings concerning Justice and the Judaic Law -A Saying against the Pharisees. -The Pharisees, who loved money, heard all this and they ridiculed him.

15.verse: He said to them, “You people pretend to be upright when you wish to impress others, but God knows what is in your hearts. That which is highly esteemed in the eyes of men is detestable in the sight of God.

16.verse: Sayings about the Law. -“The Law and the Prophets were in effect until John. From that time the kingdom of God has been proclaimed, and everyone is trying to force his way in.

17.verse: It is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one letter of the Law to be discarded.

18.verse: Sayings about Divorce. -“Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery, and anyone who marries a woman divorced from her husband commits adultery.

19.verse: The Rich Man and Lazarus: A Warning -The Parable of the Rich Man and Lazarus. -“There was a rich man who used to dress in purple garments and the finest linen and who feasted sumptuously every day.

20.verse: And at his gate lay a poor man named Lazarus, covered with sores,

21.verse: who would have been grateful to be fed with the scraps that fell from the rich man’s table. Even the dogs would come and lick his sores.

22.verse: “Now the poor man died, and he was carried away by the angels to Abraham’s side. The rich man also died and was buried.

23.verse: In the netherworld, where he was in torment, he looked up and saw Abraham, far off, and Lazarus by his side.

24.verse: And he called out, ‘Father Abraham, have pity on me. Send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, for I am in agony in these flames.’

25.verse: “But Abraham replied, ‘My child, remember that during your lifetime you received many good things, while Lazarus suffered greatly. Now he is being comforted while you are in agony.

26.verse: Moreover, between us and you a great chasm has been established, so that no one who wishes to do so can pass from our side to yours, nor can anyone pass from your side to ours.’

27.verse: “ ‘Then I beg you, father,’ he said, ‘to send him to my father’s house,

28.verse: to warn my five brothers, lest they too end up in this place of torment.’

29.verse: But Abraham responded, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets. Let them listen to them.’

30.verse: “He said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.’

31.verse: Abraham answered, ‘If they will not listen to Moses and the Prophets, they will not be persuaded even if someone should rise from the dead.’ ”

1.verse: Various Episodes and Instructions -Chapter 17 -Warning against Giving Scandal. -Jesus said to his disciples, “Scandals are bound to occur, but woe to the man through whom they come!

2.verse: It would be better for him if a millstone were fastened around his neck and he were thrown into the sea than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.

3.verse: Be on your guard!The Need To Forgive. - “If your brother should sin, rebuke him, and if he repents, forgive him.

4.verse: Even if he wrongs you seven times a day, and comes back to you seven times to say, ‘I am sorry,’ you must forgive him.”

5.verse: Faith Knows How To Make Miracles. -The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”

6.verse: The Lord replied, “If you had faith as tiny as a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.

7.verse: Unprofitable Servants. -“Which of you, when your servant returns from plowing or tending sheep in the fields, would say to him, ‘Come right away and sit down to eat’?

8.verse: Would you not rather say, ‘Prepare my dinner, put on your apron, and wait on me while I eat and drink, and then afterward you yourself may eat and drink’?

9.verse: Would you be grateful to that servant for doing what he was commanded?

10.verse: So should it be with you. When you have done all that you were ordered to do, say, ‘We are unprofitable servants; we have only done our duty.’ ”

11.verse: Jesus Heals Ten Men with Leprosy. -As he continued on his journey to Jerusalem, he traveled along the border between Samaria and Galilee.

12.verse: When he entered a village, ten lepers approached him. Standing some distance away,

13.verse: they called out to him, “Jesus, Master, have pity on us.”

14.verse: When he saw them, he said, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” And as they went, they were cleansed.

15.verse: One of them, when he realized that he had been cured, came back, praising God in a loud voice.

16.verse: He prostrated himself at the feet of Jesus and thanked him. This man was a Samaritan.

17.verse: Jesus asked, “Were not all ten made clean? Where are the other nine?

18.verse: Has no one except this foreigner returned to give thanks to God?”

19.verse: Then he said to him, “Stand up and go on your way. Your faith has made you well.”

20.verse: The Coming of the Kingdom of God. -Once, the Pharisees asked him when the kingdom of God was coming. He answered, “The coming of the kingdom of God will not occur with signs that can be observed.

21.verse: Nor will people say, ‘Here it is,’ or ‘There it is.’ For the kingdom of God is in your midst.”

22.verse: The Day of the Son of Man. -Then he said to his disciples, “The time will come when you will long to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.

23.verse: People will say to you, ‘Look, there he is,’ or ‘Look, here he is.’ Do not go running after them.

24.verse: For just as lightning flashes and lights up the sky from one end to the other, so will the Son of Man be in his day.

25.verse: But first he must endure great suffering and be rejected by this generation.

26.verse: “Just as it was in the days of Noah, so will it also be in the days of the Son of Man.

27.verse: People were eating and drinking, marrying and being given in marriage, up to the day that Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed all of them.

28.verse: “The same thing happened in the days of Lot. People were eating and drinking, buying and selling, planting and building.

29.verse: But on the day that Lot left Sodom, fire and brimstone rained down from heaven and destroyed all of them.

30.verse: “It will be like that on the day that the Son of Man is revealed.

31.verse: On that day, the one who is standing on the roof, with his possessions inside, must not come down to collect them, and someone who is in the field must not turn back.

32.verse: Remember Lot’s wife.

33.verse: Whoever tries to preserve his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life will save it.

34.verse: “I tell you, on that night two people will be in one bed. One will be taken and the other will be left.

35.verse: And there will be two women grinding grain together. One will be taken and the other will be left. [

36.verse: Two men will be out in the field. One will be taken and the other will be left.]”

37.verse: They asked him, “Where, Lord?” He said in reply, “Where the corpse is, there the vultures will gather.”

1.verse: Chapter 18 -The Parable of the Importunate Widow. -Then Jesus told them a parable about the need for them to pray always and never to lose heart.

2.verse: He said, “In a certain town there was a judge who neither feared God nor had any respect for people.

3.verse: In that same town there was a widow who kept coming to him and pleading, ‘Grant me justice against my adversary.’

4.verse: “For a long time he refused her request, but finally he said to himself, ‘Even though I neither fear God nor have any respect for people,

5.verse: yet because this widow keeps pestering me, I will see to it that she gets justice. Otherwise, she will keep coming and wear me out.’ ”

6.verse: Then the Lord said, “You have heard what the unjust judge says.

7.verse: Will not God, therefore, grant justice to his elect who cry out to him day and night? Will he delay in answering their pleas?

8.verse: I tell you, he will grant them justice quickly. But when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”

9.verse: The Parable of the Pharisee and the Tax Collector. -He also told the following parable to some people who prided themselves about their own righteousness and regarded others with contempt:

10.verse: “Two men went up to the temple to pray. One was a Pharisee and the other was a tax collector.

11.verse: The Pharisee stood up and said this prayer to himself: ‘I thank you, God, that I am not like other people—greedy, dishonest, adulterous—or even like this tax collector.

12.verse: I fast twice a week and pay tithes on all my income.’

13.verse: “The tax collector, however, stood some distance away and would not even raise his eyes to heaven. Rather, he kept beating his breast as he said, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner.’

14.verse: This man, I tell you, returned to his home justified, whereas the other did not. For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”

15.verse: Jesus Blesses the Children. -People were bringing even infants to Jesus so that he might touch them. When the disciples observed this, they rebuked them.

16.verse: However, Jesus called the children to him and said, “Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them. For it is to such as these that the kingdom of God belongs.

17.verse: Amen, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”

18.verse: The Rich Young Man. -A certain ruler asked him, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”

19.verse: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good but God alone.

20.verse: You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit adultery. Do not kill. Do not steal. Do not bear false witness. Honor your father and your mother.’ ”

21.verse: The man replied, “I have kept all these since I was a child.”

22.verse: On hearing this, Jesus said to him, “You need to do one further thing. Sell everything you own and distribute the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”

23.verse: But when he heard this, he became sad, because he was very rich.

24.verse: Danger of Riches. -Jesus looked at him and said, “How difficult it is for those who are rich to enter the kingdom of God!

25.verse: Indeed, it is easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.”

26.verse: Those who heard this asked, “Then who can be saved?”

27.verse: He replied, “What is impossible for men is possible for God.”

28.verse: The Reward of Renunciation. -Peter said to him, “We have given up our homes to follow you.”

29.verse: Jesus replied, “Amen, I say to you, there is no one who has given up house or wife or brothers or parents or children for the sake of the kingdom of God

30.verse: who will not receive many times as much in this age, and eternal life in the age to come.”

31.verse: Jesus Predicts His Passion a Third Time. -Then Jesus took the Twelve aside and said to them, “Behold, we are now going up to Jerusalem, and everything that has been written by the Prophets about the Son of Man will be fulfilled.

32.verse: He will be handed over to the Gentiles, and he will be mocked and insulted and spat upon.

33.verse: After they have scourged him, they will put him to death, and on the third day he will rise again.”

34.verse: But they understood nothing of this. Its meaning remained obscure to them, and they failed to comprehend what he was telling them.

35.verse: Jesus Heals a Blind Man. -As Jesus approached Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the roadside begging.

36.verse: When he heard the crowd going past, he inquired what was happening.

37.verse: They told him, “Jesus of Nazareth is passing by.”

38.verse: He shouted, “Jesus, Son of David, have pity on me!”

39.verse: The people in front rebuked him and ordered him to be silent, but he only shouted all the louder, “Son of David, have pity on me!”

40.verse: Jesus stopped and ordered that the man be brought to him. And when he had come near, Jesus asked him,

41.verse: “What do you want me to do for you?” He answered, “Lord, let me receive my sight.”

42.verse: Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight. Your faith has made you well.”

43.verse: Immediately, he received his sight and followed Jesus, praising God. And all the people who witnessed this also gave praise to God.

1.verse: Chapter 19 -Jesus and Zacchaeus, the Rich Tax Collector. -Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through it.

2.verse: A man there, named Zacchaeus, was a chief tax collector and a rich man.

3.verse: He wanted to see who Jesus was, but since he was short in stature, he could not see him because of the crowd.

4.verse: Therefore, he ran ahead and climbed a sycamore tree in order to catch a glimpse of him for he was going to pass that way.

5.verse: When he reached that spot, Jesus looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for I must stay at your house today.”

6.verse: Zacchaeus came down quickly and welcomed him joyfully.

7.verse: When the people observed this, they began to complain, saying, “He has gone to be the guest of a man who is a sinner.”

8.verse: But Zacchaeus stood there and said to the Lord, “Behold, Lord, I intend to give half of everything I possess to the poor, and if I have defrauded someone of anything, I will repay that amount four times over.”

9.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, because this man too is a son of Abraham.

10.verse: For the Son of Man has come to seek out and to save what was lost.”

11.verse: The Parable of the Ten Gold Coins. -While the people were listening to him speak, Jesus went on to tell them a parable, because now he was near Jerusalem and because they thought that the kingdom of God might appear immediately.

12.verse: He said, “A man of noble birth was preparing to go to a distant country to receive a kingdom and then return.

13.verse: So he summoned ten of his servants and gave them ten gold coins, instructing them, ‘Trade with the money I have given you until I return.’

14.verse: But the citizens of his country hated him and sent a delegation after him to give this message, ‘We do not want this man to be our king.’

15.verse: “When he returned after having been made king, he sent for the servants to whom he had given the money to ascertain what profit they had made through their trading.

16.verse: The first came forward and said, ‘Sir, your money has increased tenfold in value.’

17.verse: He said to him, ‘Well done, my good servant. Because you have proved trustworthy in this very small matter, you shall be in charge of ten cities.’

18.verse: “Next, the second servant came forward and said, ‘Sir, your money has increased fivefold in value.’

19.verse: He said to him, ‘You shall be in charge of five cities.’

20.verse: “Then the third one came forward, saying, ‘Sir, here is your money. I kept it wrapped up in a handkerchief.

21.verse: For I was afraid of you, because you are a hard man. You take out what you did not put down, and you reap what you did not sow.’

22.verse: “The master said to him, ‘I will condemn you by your own words, you wicked servant. You knew I was a hard man, taking out what I did not put down, and reaping what I did not sow.

23.verse: Why then did you not deposit my money into a bank so that on my return I could have drawn it out with interest?’

24.verse: “Then he said to those standing by, ‘Take the money from him and give it to the one with the ten gold coins.’

25.verse: They said to him, ‘But sir, he already has ten gold coins.’

26.verse: He replied, ‘I tell you, to everyone who has, more will be given, but from the one who has not, even what he does have will be taken away.

27.verse: But as for those enemies of mine who did not want me for their king, bring them here and put them to death in my presence.’ ”

28.verse: The Activity of Jesus at Jerusalem -Jesus Enters Jerusalem as the Messiah. -After he had said this, Jesus proceeded on his journey up to Jerusalem.

29.verse: As he drew near to Bethphage and Bethany at the place called the Mount of Olives, he sent off two of the disciples, saying,

30.verse: “Go into the village directly ahead, and upon entering it, you will find tied there a colt on which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.

31.verse: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ simply say, ‘The Lord needs it.’ ”

32.verse: The two disciples who had been sent went off and found everything just as he had told them.

33.verse: As they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, “Why are you untying the colt?”

34.verse: They answered, “The Lord needs it.”

35.verse: Then they brought the colt to Jesus, and after spreading their cloaks over the colt, they helped Jesus to mount it.

36.verse: As he rode along, people kept spreading their cloaks on the road.

37.verse: And when he approached the downward path of the Mount of Olives, the entire multitude of his disciples began to praise God joyfully with a loud voice for all the mighty works they had seen him perform,

38.verse: proclaiming:“Blessed is the kingwho comes in the name of the Lord.Peace in heavenand glory in the highest heavens.”

39.verse: Some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples.”

40.verse: He answered, “I tell you, if they keep silent, the stones will cry out.”

41.verse: The Lament over Jerusalem. -As Jesus drew near and beheld the city, he wept over it,

42.verse: saying, “If only you had recognized on this day what would bring you peace! But now it is hidden from your sight.

43.verse: Indeed, the days will come upon you when your enemies will raise up fortifications all around you and hem you in on every side.

44.verse: They will smash you to the ground, you and your children with you, and they will not leave one stone upon another in you, because you did not recognize the time of your visitation.”

45.verse: Jesus Cleanses the Temple. -Then he entered the temple and began to drive out those who were engaging in selling,

46.verse: saying to them, “It is written,‘My house shall be a house of prayer,’but you have made it a den of thieves.”

47.verse: Every day he was teaching in the temple. But the chief priests, the scribes, and the leaders of the people plotted to kill him.

48.verse: However, they were unable to do so because all the people hung on his every word.

1.verse: Verbal Clashes -Chapter 20 -The Authority of Jesus Questioned. -One day as Jesus was teaching in the temple and proclaiming the good news, the chief priests and scribes, accompanied by the elders, approached and

2.verse: said to him, “Tell us by what authority you are doing these things. Or who is it that gave you this authority?”

3.verse: He said to them in reply, “I will also ask you one question. Tell me:

4.verse: Did John’s baptism originate from heaven or from men?”

5.verse: The question caused them to discuss it among themselves, saying, “If we say: ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’

6.verse: But if we say: ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are convinced that John was a prophet.”

7.verse: Therefore, they answered that they did not know where it came from.

8.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Then neither shall I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

9.verse: The Parable of the Tenants. -Then Jesus began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, leased it to tenants, and went off on a journey for a long period.

10.verse: “When the time arrived, he sent a servant to the tenants to receive his share of the produce of the vineyard. But the tenants beat the servant and sent him away empty-handed.

11.verse: Again, he sent another servant, but him they also beat and treated shamefully and sent away empty-handed.

12.verse: Then he sent a third servant, but him too they wounded and cast out.

13.verse: “Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. Perhaps they will respect him.’

14.verse: But when the tenants saw him, they said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Let us kill him so that the inheritance will be ours.’

15.verse: And so they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.“What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?

16.verse: He will come and put those tenants to death and give the vineyard to others.”When the people heard this, they said, “God forbid!”

17.verse: But Jesus looked directly at them and said, “Then what is the meaning of that which is written:‘The stone that the builders rejectedhas become the cornerstone’?

18.verse: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken into pieces, and the one on whom it falls will be crushed.”

19.verse: The scribes and the chief priests realized that this parable was directed at them, and they wanted to seize him at that very hour, but they feared the people.

20.verse: God or Caesar. -So they watched him closely and sent spies who pretended to be honorable men. They intended to trap Jesus in something he might say so that they could hand him over to the authority and jurisdiction of the governor.

21.verse: They posed this question to him: “Teacher, we know that you say and teach what is right. Moreover, you show no partiality to anyone but teach the way of God in accordance with the truth.

22.verse: Is it lawful or not for us to pay taxes to Caesar?”

23.verse: Jesus saw through their duplicity and said to them,

24.verse: “Show me a coin. Whose image is this, and whose inscription?” They replied, “Caesar’s.”

25.verse: He said to them, “Give to Caesar what is due to Caesar, and to God what is due to God.”

26.verse: They found they could not trap him by anything he said in the presence of the people, and, stunned at his reply, they fell silent.

27.verse: Marriage and the Resurrection. -Then some Sadducees, who assert that there is no resurrection, approached him and posed this question:

28.verse: “Teacher, Moses wrote down for us that if a man’s brother dies, having a wife but no children, the man must marry his brother’s wife and raise up children for his brother.

29.verse: Now there were seven brothers. The first married a woman but died childless.

30.verse: Then the second

31.verse: and the third married the widow, and it was the same with all seven: they all died leaving no children.

32.verse: Last of all, the woman also died.

33.verse: Now at the resurrection, whose wife will the woman be, inasmuch as all seven had her?”

34.verse: Jesus said to them, “The children of this age marry and are given in marriage,

35.verse: but those who are judged worthy of taking part in the age to come and in the resurrection of the dead will neither marry nor be given in marriage.

36.verse: They are no longer subject to death, for they are like angels; and they are the children of God because they are children of the resurrection.

37.verse: “That the dead are raised Moses himself showed in the account about the bush where he calls the Lord the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.

38.verse: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for in his sight all are alive.”

39.verse: Some of the scribes then said, “Teacher, you have answered well.”

40.verse: And they no longer dared to ask him anything.

41.verse: Jesus Is Lord. -Then Jesus said to them, “How can they say that the Christ is the Son of David?

42.verse: For David himself says in the Book of Psalms:‘The Lord said to my Lord:“Sit at my right hand

43.verse: until I make your enemies your footstool.” ’

44.verse: David thus calls him ‘Lord’; so how can he be his son?”

45.verse: Denunciation of the Scribes. -While all the people were listening, Jesus said to his disciples,

46.verse: “Beware of the scribes who like to walk around in long robes and who love to be greeted respectfully in the marketplaces, and to have the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.

47.verse: They devour the houses of widows, while for the sake of appearance they recite lengthy prayers. They will receive the severest possible condemnation.”

1.verse: Chapter 21 -The Poor Widow’s Offering. -Looking up, Jesus saw wealthy people putting their offerings into the treasury,

2.verse: and he also noticed a poor widow putting in two copper coins.

3.verse: He said: “Truly I tell you, this poor widow has given more than all the rest.

4.verse: For the others have all contributed out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty has given all that she had to live on.”

5.verse: The Destruction of the Temple and the Return of Christ -Jesus Announces the Destruction of the Temple. -When some people were talking about how the temple was adorned with beautiful stones and votive offerings, Jesus remarked,

6.verse: “As for all these things that you are gazing at now, the time will come when not one stone here will be left upon another; everything will be thrown down.”

7.verse: The Signs of the End. -They then asked him, “Teacher, when will this happen? And what will be the sign that it is about to take place?”

8.verse: He answered, “Take care not to be deceived. For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and ‘The time is near.’ Do not follow them.

9.verse: And when you hear of wars and insurrections, do not be terrified, for those things are bound to take place first, but the end will not follow immediately.”

10.verse: Then he added, “Nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom.

11.verse: There will be tremendous earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places, as well as dreadful portents and great signs from heaven.

12.verse: The Coming Persecution. -“But before all this happens, they will seize you and persecute you. You will be handed over to synagogues and imprisoned, and you will be brought before kings and governors because of my name.

13.verse: This will give you an opportunity to bear witness to me.

14.verse: But do not even consider preparing your defense beforehand,

15.verse: for I myself will give you a depth of wisdom and eloquence that none of your adversaries will be able to resist or contradict.

16.verse: “You will be betrayed even by parents and brothers, relatives and friends, and some of you will be put to death.

17.verse: You will be hated by all because of my name,

18.verse: but not a hair of your head will be lost.

19.verse: By standing firm you will gain life.

20.verse: The Great Trial. -“When you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, you may be certain that her desolation is near.

21.verse: Then those who are in Judea must flee to the mountains, and those who are within the city must escape from its boundaries, and those who are in country areas must not return.

22.verse: For those will be days of retribution when all that is written will come to pass.

23.verse: “Woe to those who are pregnant and those who are nursing infants in those days. For there will be great distress on the earth, and terrible wrath shall afflict this people.

24.verse: They will fall by the sword and be carried away as captives among all the nations, and Jerusalem will be trampled underfoot by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles have been fulfilled.

25.verse: The Coming of the Son of Man. -“There will be signs in the sun, the moon, and the stars, and on earth nations will be in great distress, bewildered at the roaring of the sea and its waves.

26.verse: Men will grow faint with terror and apprehension at what is coming upon the earth, for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

27.verse: And then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

28.verse: When these things begin to take place, look up and hold your heads high, because the time of your redemption is drawing near.”

29.verse: The Parable of the Fig Tree. -Then he told them this parable: “Look at the fig tree or indeed at any other tree.

30.verse: As soon as it begins to bud, you know that summer is already near.

31.verse: In the same way, when you see these things come to pass, know that the kingdom of God is near.

32.verse: Amen, I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things have taken place.

33.verse: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

34.verse: Exhortation To Be Vigilant. -“Be on your guard lest your hearts be weighed down by carousing and drunkenness and the anxieties of this life and that day will catch you unawares,

35.verse: like a trap. For that day will come upon everyone in the world.

36.verse: Be vigilant at all times, praying for the strength to survive all those things that will take place and to stand in the presence of the Son of Man.”

37.verse: Jesus’ Last Days in Jerusalem. -Each day Jesus was teaching in the temple, but every evening he would go forth and spend the night on the hill called the Mount of Olives.

38.verse: And all the people would rise early every morning to listen to him in the temple.

1.verse: The Passion and Resurrection -Chapter 22 -The Conspiracy against Jesus. -Now the feast of Unleavened Bread, known as the Passover, was drawing near,

2.verse: and the chief priests and the scribes were looking for some way to put Jesus to death, for they were afraid of the people.

3.verse: Judas Betrays Jesus. -Then Satan entered into Judas, called Iscariot, who was one of the Twelve.

4.verse: And he went to the chief priests and temple guards to discuss how he might betray Jesus to them

5.verse: They were delighted and agreed to give him money.

6.verse: He accepted their offer and began to look for an opportunity to betray him to them when no crowd was present.

7.verse: The Last Supper -The Preparations for the Passover. -When the day of the feast of Unleavened Bread arrived, on which the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed,

8.verse: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and make the preparations for us to eat the Passover.”

9.verse: They asked him, “Where do you want us to make the preparations?”

10.verse: He replied, “When you enter the city, a man will meet you carrying a jug of water. Follow him into the house that he enters

11.verse: and say to the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says this to you: “Where is the room where I can eat the Passover with my disciples?” ’

12.verse: Then he will show you a large upper room that is furnished. Make the preparations there.”

13.verse: They went forth and found everything just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.

14.verse: The Last Supper. -When the hour came, Jesus took his place at table along with the apostles.

15.verse: He said to them, “I have eagerly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.

16.verse: For I tell you that from this moment on I shall never eat it again until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”

17.verse: Then he took a cup, and after giving thanks he said, “Take this and share it among yourselves.

18.verse: For I tell you that from this moment I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”

19.verse: Jesus Gives His Body and His Blood. -Then he took bread, and after giving thanks he broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body, which will be given for you. Do this in memory of me.”

20.verse: And he did the same with the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which will be poured out for you.

21.verse: The Betrayer Foretold. -“But behold, the hand of the one who will betray me is here with me on the table.

22.verse: The Son of Man goes on his appointed path, but woe to that man by whom he is betrayed.”

23.verse: Then they began to question among themselves as to which one of them might do this.

24.verse: The Disciples Are To Serve on Earth. -Then a dispute also broke out among them as to which one of them should be considered the greatest.

25.verse: Jesus said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those who exercise authority over them are given the title of ‘Benefactor.’

26.verse: “But it must not be so with you. Rather, the greatest among you should be like the youngest, and the leader must be like the one who serves.

27.verse: For who is greater—the one seated at table or the one who serves? Surely, the one who sits at table. And yet I am in your midst as one who serves.

28.verse: Judges of the Twelve Tribes. -“You are the ones who have stood by my side in my trials,

29.verse: and now I confer on you a kingdom just as my Father has conferred one on me.

30.verse: In my kingdom, you will eat and drink at my table, and you will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

31.verse: Peter’s Denial Foretold. -“Simon, Simon, behold, Satan has desired to sift all of you like wheat.

32.verse: But I have prayed that your own faith may not fail. And once you have turned back, you must strengthen your brethren.”

33.verse: Simon said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you to prison and to death.”

34.verse: Jesus replied, “I tell you, Peter, before the cock crows today, you will deny three times that you know me.”

35.verse: Instructions for the Time of Crisis. -Then Jesus said to them, “When I sent you forth without a money bag or sack or sandals, were you ever in need of anything?” They answered, “No, not a thing.”

36.verse: He then remarked, “But now, the one who has a money bag should take it with him, as well as a sack. And if you do not have a sword, sell your cloak and purchase one.

37.verse: “For I tell you that this Scripture must be fulfilled in me: ‘He was numbered with the wicked.’ Indeed, everything written about me is being fulfilled.”

38.verse: They said, “See, Lord, here are two swords.” He said to them, “That is enough.”

39.verse: The Passion -The Agony in the Garden. -Jesus then went forth and made his way, as was his custom, to the Mount of Olives, and the disciples followed him.

40.verse: When he reached the place, he said to them, “Pray that you may not enter into temptation.”

41.verse: After withdrawing from them about a stone’s throw, he knelt down and prayed,

42.verse: saying, “Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me. Yet not my will but yours be done.”

43.verse: Then an angel from heaven appeared to him and gave him strength.

44.verse: In his anguish, he prayed so fervently that his sweat became like great drops of blood falling on the ground.

45.verse: When he rose from prayer and returned to the disciples, he found them sleeping, exhausted by grief.

46.verse: He said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray that you may not enter into temptation.”

47.verse: Jesus Is Betrayed and Arrested. -While he was still speaking, a crowd of men suddenly approached, and the one called Judas, one of the Twelve, was leading them. He came up to Jesus to kiss him,

48.verse: but Jesus said, “Judas, would you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”

49.verse: When Jesus’ disciples realized what was about to happen, they asked, “Lord, should we strike with our swords?”

50.verse: And one of them struck a servant of the high priest, slicing off his right ear.

51.verse: But Jesus said, “Stop! No more of this!” He then touched the servant’s ear and healed him.

52.verse: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, the officers of the temple guard, and the elders who had come for him, “Why are you coming forth with swords and clubs as though I were a bandit?

53.verse: When I was with you day after day in the temple, you did not raise a hand against me. But this is the hour for you and the power of darkness.”

54.verse: Peter Denies Jesus. -Then they arrested Jesus and led him away. They brought him into the house of the high priest, and Peter followed at a distance.

55.verse: Lighting a fire in the middle of the courtyard, they sat around it, and Peter sat with them.

56.verse: A servant girl saw him sitting by the fire, looked closely at him, and said, “This man also was with him.”

57.verse: But he denied it, saying, “Woman, I do not know him.”

58.verse: A short time later, someone else saw him and said, “You too are one of them,” but Peter replied, “No, I am not.”

59.verse: About an hour later, another person strongly insisted, “This man was unquestionably with him, for he is a Galilean.”

60.verse: Peter said, “My friend, I do not know what you are talking about.” At that very moment, while he was still speaking, a cock crowed,

61.verse: and the Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter recalled the word that the Lord had spoken to him: “Before the cock crows today, you will deny me three times.”

62.verse: And he went out and wept uncontrollably.

63.verse: The men who were guarding Jesus began to mock him and to beat him.

64.verse: They also blindfolded him and kept asking him, “Prophesy! Who hit you?”

65.verse: And they continued to taunt him with insult after insult.

66.verse: Jesus before the Sanhedrin. -When the dawn came, the council of the elders of the people, both the chief priests and the scribes, assembled, and they brought him before their Sanhedrin.

67.verse: Then they said, “If you are the Christ, tell us!” He replied, “If I tell you, you will not believe;

68.verse: and if I question you, you will not answer.

69.verse: But from now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”

70.verse: All of them asked, “Are you then the Son of God?” He replied, “It is you who say that I am.”

71.verse: Then they said, “What need do we have for any further testimony? We have heard it ourselves from his own lips.”

1.verse: Chapter 23 -Jesus before Pilate. -Then the entire assembly rose and brought Jesus before Pilate.

2.verse: They began to accuse him, saying, “We charge this man with subverting our nation, opposing the payment of taxes to Caesar, and claiming that he is the Christ, a king.”

3.verse: Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” He replied, “You have said so.”

4.verse: Pilate then said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no evidence of a crime in this man.”

5.verse: But they continued to insist, saying, “He is stirring up the people by his teaching throughout all Judea, from Galilee, where he started, all the way to here.”

6.verse: When Pilate heard this, he asked if the man was a Galilean,

7.verse: and upon learning that he came under Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod who was also in Jerusalem at that time.

8.verse: Jesus before Herod. -Herod was delighted when he saw Jesus, for he had heard about him and had been hoping for some time to see him and perhaps to witness him perform some sign.

9.verse: He questioned him at length, but Jesus gave him no reply.

10.verse: The chief priests and the scribes meanwhile were present, and they vehemently made accusations against him.

11.verse: Herod and his soldiers treated him with contempt and mocked him. Then Herod had him clothed in an elegant robe and sent him back to Pilate.

12.verse: That very day Herod and Pilate became friends, although previously they had been enemies.

13.verse: Jesus before Pilate Again. -Pilate then summoned the chief priests and the rulers and the people,

14.verse: and said to them, “You brought this man before me and accused him of inciting the people to rebellion. I have examined him here in your presence and have not found him guilty of any of the charges you have brought against him.

15.verse: Nor did Herod, for he has sent him back to us. It is clear that he has done nothing deserving of death.

16.verse: Therefore, I will have him scourged and then release him.”Jesus Is Condemned to Death. - [

17.verse: Now Pilate was obliged to release one man to them at the time of the festival.]

18.verse: And then the crowd all shouted in unison, “Away with this man! Release Barabbas to us!”

19.verse: (He had been imprisoned for an insurrection that had occurred in the city as well as for murder.)

20.verse: In his desire to release Jesus, Pilate again pleaded with them,

21.verse: but, they continued to shout, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”

22.verse: A third time he addressed them: “Why? What evil has he done? I have not found in him any crime that deserves death. Therefore, I will have him scourged and let him go.”

23.verse: However, with loud shouts they continued to insist that he should be crucified, and their voices prevailed.

24.verse: Pilate ordered that what they wanted was to be granted.

25.verse: He released the man they asked for, who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, and he handed over Jesus to them to deal with as they wished.

26.verse: The Way of the Cross. -As they led him away, they seized a man from Cyrene named Simon, who was returning from the country. They put the cross on his back and forced him to carry it behind Jesus.

27.verse: A large number of people followed Jesus, among them many women who were mourning and lamenting over him.

28.verse: But he turned to them and said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me. Weep rather for yourselves and for your children.

29.verse: For behold, the days are coming when people will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore children and the breasts that never nursed.’

30.verse: Then they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us!’

31.verse: For if they do these things when the wood is green, what will happen when it is dry?”

32.verse: Jesus Is Crucified. -There were also two others, both criminals, who were led away to be executed with him.

33.verse: When they came to the place called The Skull, they crucified Jesus there along with the two criminals, one on his right and the other on his left.

34.verse: Then Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” And they cast lots to divide his garments.

35.verse: The people stood there watching. Meanwhile, the rulers jeered at him and said, “He saved others. Let him save himself if he is the Christ of God, the Chosen One.”

36.verse: Even the soldiers mocked him. As they came forward to offer him sour wine,

37.verse: they said, “If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!”

38.verse: There was also an inscription above his head that said, “This is the King of the Jews.”

39.verse: One of the criminals hanging there taunted Jesus, saying, “Are you not the Christ? Save yourself and us!”

40.verse: But the other rebuked him, “Have you no fear of God, since you are under the same sentence?

41.verse: In our case, we have been condemned justly, for we are getting what we deserve for our deeds. But this man has committed no wrong.”

42.verse: Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom.”

43.verse: Jesus said to him, “Amen, I say to you, today you will be with me in Paradise.”

44.verse: Jesus Dies on the Cross. -It was now about noon, and darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon,

45.verse: for the sun was darkened. Then the veil of the temple was torn in two.

46.verse: He cried out, “Father, into your hands I commend my spirit.” And with these words he breathed his last.

47.verse: On seeing what had taken place, the centurion praised God and said, “Surely, this man was innocent.”

48.verse: When all the people who had gathered there to witness the spectacle saw what had happened, they returned home beating their breasts.

49.verse: However, all his acquaintances, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance and watched all these events.

50.verse: Jesus Is Buried. -Now there was a good and upright man named Joseph who was a member of the council.

51.verse: However, he had not agreed to their plan and the action they had taken. He came from the Jewish town of Arimathea, and he was awaiting the kingdom of God.

52.verse: This man went to Pilate and requested the body of Jesus.

53.verse: Then he took it down, wrapped it in a linen shroud, and laid him in a tomb that had been hewn out of rock in which no one had ever been interred.

54.verse: It was the Day of Preparation, and the Sabbath was about to begin.

55.verse: The women who had accompanied Jesus from Galilee followed Joseph. They saw the tomb and how his body was laid in it.

56.verse: Then they returned and prepared spices and ointments. But on the Sabbath they rested in obedience to the commandment.

1.verse: The Resurrection -Chapter 24 -Jesus Rises from the Dead. -At daybreak on the first day of the week, the women came to the tomb with the spices they had prepared.

2.verse: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb,

3.verse: but when they went inside, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.

4.verse: While they stood there wondering about this, suddenly two men in dazzling clothes appeared at their side.

5.verse: They were terrified and bowed their faces to the ground, but the men said to them, “Why do you look among the dead for one who is alive?

6.verse: He is not here. He has been raised. Remember what he told you while he was still in Galilee:

7.verse: that the Son of Man must be handed over to sinners and be crucified and rise again on the third day.”

8.verse: Then they recalled his words.

9.verse: When they returned from the tomb, they reported all these things to the Eleven and to all the others.

10.verse: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them who told this to the apostles.

11.verse: However, this story of theirs seemed to be nonsense, and the apostles did not believe them.

12.verse: Nonetheless, Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Bending over, he looked inside and saw only the linen cloths. Then he returned home, wondering what had occurred.

13.verse: Jesus Appears to Two Disciples at Emmaus. -Now that same day two of them were on their way to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem,

14.verse: and they were talking with each other about all these things that had occurred.

15.verse: While they were conversing and discussing these events, Jesus himself drew near and walked along with them,

16.verse: but their eyes were prevented from recognizing him.

17.verse: He asked them, “What are you discussing with each other as you walk along?” They stood still, their faces filled with sadness.

18.verse: Then one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answered him, “Are you the only stranger in Jerusalem who is not aware of all the things that have taken place there in these days?”

19.verse: When he asked, “What things?” they replied, “The things that happened to Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet powerful in word and deed before God and all the people,

20.verse: and how our chief priests and rulers handed him over to be sentenced to death and had him crucified.

21.verse: “We had been hoping that he would be the one who would redeem Israel. And what is more, this is the third day since all of this took place.

22.verse: Some women from our group have now given us astounding news. They went to the tomb early this morning,

23.verse: but they failed to find his body. When they returned, they told us that they had seen a vision of angels who reported that he was alive.

24.verse: Some of our companions went to the tomb and found everything exactly as the women had said, but they did not see him.”

25.verse: Then he said to them, “How foolish you are, and how slow to believe all that the Prophets have spoken!

26.verse: Was it not necessary that the Christ should suffer these things and enter into his glory?”

27.verse: Then, beginning with Moses and going through all the Prophets, he interpreted for them all the passages from the Scriptures that pertained to him.

28.verse: As they approached the village to which they were going, he acted as though he would be going further.

29.verse: However, they urged him strongly, “Stay with us, for it is nearly evening and the day is almost over.” And so he went in to stay with them.

30.verse: When he was at table with them, he took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them.

31.verse: Then their eyes were opened and they recognized him, but he vanished from their sight.

32.verse: They said to each other, “Were not our hearts burning within us while he spoke to us on the road and opened the Scriptures to us?”

33.verse: They set out immediately and returned to Jerusalem, where they found gathered together the Eleven and their companions

34.verse: who were saying, “The Lord has truly been raised, and he has appeared to Simon!”

35.verse: Then the two described what had happened on their journey and how he had made himself known to them in the breaking of the bread.

36.verse: Jesus Appears to the Disciples in Jerusalem. -While they were still conversing about this, Jesus himself stood in their midst and said to them, “Peace be with you.”

37.verse: Startled and terrified, they thought that they were seeing a ghost.

38.verse: He said to them, “Why are you troubled, and why are doubts arising in your hearts?

39.verse: Look at my hands and my feet. It is I myself. Touch me and see. For a ghost does not have flesh and bones as you can see that I have.”

40.verse: And when he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.

41.verse: In spite of their joy and amazement, they were still incredulous. So he said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”

42.verse: They gave him a piece of fish,

43.verse: and he took it and ate it in their presence.

44.verse: Then he said to them, “This is what I meant when I told you while I was still with you: Everything written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets, and the Psalms must be fulfilled.”

45.verse: Thereupon, he opened their minds to understand the Scriptures.

46.verse: And he said to them, “Thus it is written that the Christ would suffer and on the third day rise from the dead,

47.verse: and that in his name repentance and forgiveness of sins are to be proclaimed to all nations, beginning from Jerusalem.

48.verse: You are witnesses to all these things.

49.verse: “And behold, I am sending upon you the gift promised by my Father. Therefore, stay here in the city until you have been clothed with power from on high.”

50.verse: Jesus Ascends to Heaven. -Then he led them out as far as Bethany, and lifting up his hands he blessed them.

51.verse: While he was blessing them, he departed from them and was taken up to heaven.

52.verse: They worshiped him and then returned to Jerusalem filled with great joy,

53.verse: and they were continually in the temple praising God.
